circumstances: En route from Christiansted to Charlotte Amalie, while in cruising altitude, one of the engine failed. The pilot attempted to ditch the aircraft off St Thomas Island when the seaplane crashed into the sea. Three passengers and the pilot, Cpt Charles Blair (69), owner of the company, were killed. Seven other occupants were injured. The aircraft was lost.
probable_cause:
Engine failure in flight due to improper maintenance. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Powerplant failure due to engine structure: cylinder assembly, 
- Fatigue fracture, 
- Improper in-flight decisions or planning, 
- Improper emergency procedures, 
- Inadequate supervision of flight crew, 
- Deficiency, company maintained equipment, services, regulation, 
- Rules, regulations, standards personnel,
- Aircraft came to rest in water, 
- Forced landing off airport on water, 
- STC approved flight at 8,750 lbs mass gross weight, 
- Test indicate mass gross weight 8,150 lbs.
